metadata.name: Container Instances Container Groups
metadata.description: This module deploys a Container Instance Container Group.
Required. Name for the container group.
Required. The containers and their respective config within the container group.
Conditional. Ports to open on the public IP address. Must include all ports assigned on container level. Required if `ipAddressType` is set to `public`.
Optional. The operating system type required by the containers in the container group. - Windows or Linux.
Optional. Restart policy for all containers within the container group. - Always: Always restart. OnFailure: Restart on failure. Never: Never restart. - Always, OnFailure, Never.
Optional. Specifies if the IP is exposed to the public internet or private VNET. - Public or Private.
Optional. The image registry credentials by which the container group is created from.
Optional. Location for all Resources.
Optional. Specify level of protection of the domain name label.
Optional. The Dns name label for the resource.
Optional. List of dns servers used by the containers for lookups.
Optional. DNS search domain which will be appended to each DNS lookup.
Optional. A list of container definitions which will be executed before the application container starts.
Optional. Resource ID of the subnet. Only specify when ipAddressType is Private.
Optional. Specify if volumes (emptyDir, AzureFileShare or GitRepo) shall be attached to your containergroup.
Optional. Specify the type of lock.
Optional. Enables system assigned managed identity on the resource.
Optional. The ID(s) to assign to the resource.
Optional. Tags of the resource.
Optional. Enable telemetry via a Globally Unique Identifier (GUID).
Optional. The container group SKU.
Optional. The resource ID of a key vault to reference a customer managed key for encryption from.
Optional. The name of the customer managed key to use for encryption.
Optional. The version of the customer managed key to reference for encryption. If not provided, the latest key version is used.
Conditional. User assigned identity to use when fetching the customer managed key. Required if 'cMKKeyName' is not empty.
